text:
- Sangat nyaman dan tenang. Cocok untuk kami berdua yang ingin mencari ketenangan, jauh dari kebisingan, pokoknya mantap jiwa deh.

- Bangunannya unik & interior sangat menunjang kenyamanan. Hanya mungkin untuk posisi bathtup agak kurang pas, karna posisinya ada dibawah dan mungkin tujuannya biar berasa di alam kali ya, tapi buat kami jadi kurang private gitu c.. Ya itu penilaian kami ya, mungkin temen-temen lain lebih ok kali ya dengan kondisi seperti itu😇..

- Untuk Poolnya ok banget, apalagi kemarin pas nginep yang pakai poolnya hanya kita doang, jadi berasa punya private pool😁. Keren bangetlah pokoknya, ditambah view sawahnya. Memang paling pas buat yang pengen refresing dari segala aktivitas dan kesibukan

- Massage. Kebetulan kita berdua nyobain juga dan ternyata ok banget. Wajib dicoba deh👍. Sambil menikmati alam yang ada dan ketenangan yang di sajikan bener-bener buat kita rileks banget

- Untuk pelayanan juga sangat memuaskan. Staff yang membantu pada saat check in juga sangat ramah dan sopan.

***
So.., tempat ini bener-bener recommended lah buat kalian yang ingin liburan mencari ketenangan sambil menikmati alam.

O iya, untuk kalian yang berencana nginap disini kudu cari info ke pihak Beehause Dijiwa Ubud terkait padi di sawah, karna kalau datang saat musim panen/potong maka view yang akan nampak bakal kurang OK

Sebagai catatan :
Akses jalan masuk sangat kecil, jadi untuk yang datang pakai kendaraan Mobil harus lebih waspada. Jalannya juga kurang mantap.

text: We had a perfect stay at Adiwana Bee House. The location in midst of beautiful rice fields is truly unique. Our host Angga provided such attentive and personal service throughout our stay. For instance, like most of Hotels in this area, they have regular shuttle services to downtown Ubud. However, in contrast to other hotels they wouldn’t just drop you off at some point in the center, Angga would drive as exactly to the places we needed to go, be it the monkey forest, a restaurant, a pharmacy, or during our last day even to our next hotel. Breakfast was great, can only recommend to try the floating breakfast in the pool, which was terrific. Also, we stayed at a slightly larger two-story room with private pool that had amazing views over the rice fields - can only recommend anyone staying in Ubud, to book this.
title: Had a perfect stay in Adiwana aber House

text: A breathtaking small hotel in the middle of a beautiful rice field. Not only the hotel has an incredibly beautiful complex with amazing villas, also the staff is really nice and attentive. They not only gave us great tips for Ubud and Bali, but also helped us with special requests. Be it an Indonesian sim card we needed or a scooter to make excursions, they helped us with both questions and got us all the things we needed. An absolutley awesome team! We live in one of the pool villas. Great view, nicely furnished and a real balinese oasis to relax and recover. Because we like it so much here, we extended our stay directly. We can only recommend this hotel to all who want to experience Ubud from its most beautiful side.

text:
Off the beat, quiet, boutique hotel with individual Beehive style rooms over looking the large plunge swimming pool. The view beyond over the rice fields looks East and is stunning! There are Egrets and ducks all over these fields. The sounds of frogs and cicadas at night are magical! 
The Restaurant is open plan, fully licensed and the food is good. All freshly cooked and well presented. 
The staff are delightful especially the Managers and Nano, Lina and Yvana! They cannot do enough for you. Room service and booking tours and taxis was wonderful. 
5* would have been awarded if the renovations of 2 of the rooms had been complete.... it was a bit noisy during the day.
 A very pleasant 5 day stay.
title: Good value,  first time stay in Ubud, Bali

Un-paralleled service. Bali is known for great service, Bee house was held up that expectation. On arrival our host Yoanna was wonderful. In the restaurant we we’re so we’ll taken care of by a fine young man Nano. Nano through out our entire visit was always there for us insuring a fabulous experience.
A great experience for couples, spa services were exceptional, I had a very nice young lady by the name Malita whom did a wonderful job. So kind so sincere I cannot say enough. All in all the Beehouse is a must see and stay for those looking for a serene setting with exceptional staff. We will definitely return. text:
The BeeHouse hotel is a unique cosy stay far away from the main street noises. Tucked away in the middle of Ubud closer to the Ubud centre. 

Note: This review attempts to be objective because we need to consider most businesses are yet recovering from the economic impacts of Covid and are trying their best to serve and meet customer expectations.

We booked the room with the private pool. The pool was a bit dirty and not fancy. They did attempt to clean it up a bit but some metal structures were rusted and just an eye sore.

The rooms and bathrooms were clean. The views in the photos were kind of misleading. While we were here, the rice paddy fields were just a marsh. The weather and season could be a contributing factor (Dec and heavy rains).

The room is a semi round structure made out of bamboo (with a potential thick plastic in between for insulation and rain prevention - a wild guess). When it rained the drops were quite loud - could be a potential consideration for some.

Most of the forest stays in Ubud including this one are filled with crawling creatures such as lizards, snakes, snails and slugs. This could be a deal breaker for someone with phobias. 

We requested for a floating basket which was very lovely. They went above and beyond to provide a nice decorated one. Also they helped to accomodate last minute cake and let us invite a bunch of friends in out pool without a fuss, infact they helped serve hot food, extra towels and provided extra service in cleaning up the mess. The staff were very welcoming and respectful. 

The hotel as an inhouse restaurant (8am to 10pm). They do prepare very good meals at very reasonable prices. This is super helpful as you might not want to step out for a meal and the restaurant helps meet that need. They also provide an in house massage (masseuse will do a quick setup). The massage was a 6/10 but better than having to step out of your room. 

Overall we loved our stay here and will surely come back and recommend this place to others.
title: A quite and private stay

"Greetings from Beehouse Dijiwa Ubud - a Sanctuary for the Soul",

Thank you very much for sharing your experiences staying with us at Beehouse Dijiwa Ubud by submitting your review on Tripadvisor.com. We are delighted to learned that you have enjoyed your stay at our little hideout. We truly apologize as some issue occurred during your stay.

As we are in the presences of nature and surrounded by rice fields, we expect to see some natural occupants within the habitats as you mentioned, although we have provide some prevention from them such as daily cleaning, turn down services in the afternoon and pest control services. Even when they are not around the room we can still see them around the garden as we are attached to rice fields.

Moving on to our structural design, as unique as it was created as our room were not commonly designed it has it flaws as well and we are at the moment revitalizing our room one by one. Particularly the room you were staying at will be scheduled to have pool and roof revitalization at the end of February 2023, which will add insulation to the roof and new bamboo layer, as for the pool will be totally redesign with natural stone element.

We truly appreciate your visits and detail feedbacks, and all of us at Beehouse Dijiwa Ubud are looking forward for the chance to host and welcome you back in the future.


Best regards,
Gede Adi
Operation Manager

text:
If you’re looking for a truly unique experience, this is a good spot to try.  Rooms were really stand alone small huts and only 5 of them on property.  Restaurant was great and we also had the floating breakfast that was a nice touch.

Stuff went over the top and Yuana was great.  She was always super responsive and accommodating.

Only thing to consider is that while it looks close to town, the traffic makes it about a 30+ minute ride.  However the hotel will arrange for cars for you and it’s like $10 each way.

Would totally recommend.

text:
Pros: Instagram worthy cool-looking circular wooden structure suites overlooking the fields.  2 stories high with soaking tub, seating area, and microwave below.  Has second floor patio with lounge chairs.  Delicious breakfast with fruit platter, coffee, and choice of omelette/ pancakes/ mie goreng.  Excellent and attentive service.  Clean and well maintained.  Spacious.
Cons: far from restaurants and bars (20 min drive or 30 min walk).  If walking to/ from town, bring headlamp because it's dark at night and there is no "sidewalk."  Across the field is a karaoke bar that can be heard until 9PM when people stop singing.  Construction currently occurring next to room 104.  Rice field is actually a field of weeds (irrigation problems) but still looks beautiful and green.
title: Architecturally creative hotel in ubud

text: We enjoyed a wonderful stay at Beehouse Dijiwa Ubud. This resort was booked at last minute, due to the unexpected cancellation of another hotel booking by Agoda, therefore only two nights available. However these two nights staying at Beehouse Dijiwa Ubud turned out to be the best experience of our trip to Bali this year. This resort is small in terms of scale, but is really high in service quality which gave an illusion that we were living in a big family, rather than in a hotel.  The food at Bee Cafe on site was so well prepared and delicious and you could feel the passion and commitment from the chef. Would definitely come back to stay more days at our next trip to Bali.
title: A Hidden Jewel in Ubud

text:
The recepition we recieved at this place was great. The staff are friendly and accomodating  and really do pay attention to details (The staff took care of our helmets in the rain, and held on to some stuff I left behind). The bedroom is big and has a super comfy bed. The shower has consistently hot water. There are a few channels on the TV  and the Internet was good up in the bedroom. 

The pool is massive and there is plenty of space to sit on the edge and even inside of it. The view from the rooms and the pool is awesome. 

The restraunt at the hotel is reasonably priced and has a simple but delicious menu. We ate twice there - there was no reason not to. The breakfast that was included was lovely. The eggs benedict that I had was the best I ever had in Bali!. Yummy. 

Would recommend.

text:
Adiwana is a huge conglomerate with multiple properties.
Whilst the 'Bee House' is in an amazing location overlooking the rice fields and adjacent to a spectacular paved farming walk , the Hotel has some negatives.
The walls are paper thin. The room design is not functional and disappointing in quality. Bedding stained and dusty, bed not comfortable.
The advertised inclusions had been stripped from the rooms (despite being advertised) for the 'new normal' discounted price.
Covid is not an excuse. If you open a property, advertise inclusions and charge a guest based on their expectations, you surely should deliver as advertised.
The TV was not working so a USB with a few movies on it was supplied after asking.
The wi-fi had to be configured on my laptop and phone by staff and was very average when useable.
The room had a broken sliding door and so was not lockable.
On arrival pop music blasted out of the restaurant speakers which was actually louder back in the room due to a huge sub speaker sending bass throughout the property .
Why you would take an idyllic location for peace and serenity and swamp it with pop music is beyond me. I asked and they changed the music to Balinese but it was still too loud and indeed overpowering the volume of my TV.
The artistic design and beautiful gardens make it very photographable but the property is small in reality, the food ok and extremely cheap, the staff are gentle and efficient when asked but overall I can't see the value in the normal price of AUD204.00 (IDR2,124,418.53) per night at what is becoming a tired old property lacking room maintenance and in fact, I wouldn't stay at any of their other properties based on this experience.
title: Disappointing

text:
Our trip was a kind of impromptu, a family of 2 adults and 2 kids. From the point of contact at the corporate sales, down to the resort management and team on site, we had a great response from all level.

We immediately jumped to the pool, mesmerized by the surrounding nature and vast paddy field, as far as you can see. So lovely. The food we had was also tasty, we keep ordering food ha ha, then washed it down with gin tonic. I think we gained at least 3kg by the time we checkout.

The room is sublime, we got villa with private pool (#107), huge, tastefully designed, big semi-open bathroom with natural lights and a bathtub. For some reason, no hot water, it actually did not matter to us at all, normal water was so great and refreshing. The villa has plenty of plug point and it has a good natural light as well as well ventilated. It is facing East and morning sun is just a great thing to have...

We did a small paddy field trekking, wich was awesome...

Superb stay... thank you bu Wiwik, Pak Adi, Bli Bagaskara, and all staffs... hope to be back again soon.
title: A Slice of Paradise

text: This place is amazing, one of my favorite stays- ever! The staff is awesome, the location is central while also being remote, with stunning nature. Beautiful sunsets over the rice fields. Their included breakfast is available ALL day and you can even get it delivered to your room and it's a GREAT breakfast- omelets, sausage, bacon and yummy croissant and fruit with butter and different jam options (plus they have noodle and sandwich options). They even packed us a snack pack for our hike to Mnt Batur when we couldn't do lunch. Your room booking also includes daily high tea which we had both days by/ in their lovely pool (which is perfect- such a cool design)! They will help you with a scooter rental and laundry if needed. The beds are comfy, you can tell that the staff truly cares about you having a great time. We had to swap out our scooter one day and one of the staff members made sure to get the gas I had already purchased for my scooter out of the tank and store it in bottles so that I wouldn't have to buy gas again for my new scooter... so above and beyond! Very responsive, attentive and fast! Our stay included a floating breakfast which was divine, and super cute, I highly recommend that!  Especially perfect for a romantic trip. Huge stand alone bath tub in the room! Stay here! You will love it!
title: AMAZING HEAVEN NESTLED IN STUNNING RICE FIELDS

text: THIS PLACE IS IT!  We stayed four nights and wish we could have stayed longer.  Everything from the service the the location to the unique property made this one of the most best experiences ever.  Anna was so helpful in helping as well as all the front staff.  This small property (7 Villas I believe) has so much staff making the ratio to guest perfect.  The room (we stayed in a suite which I HIGHLY recommend) was amazing.  The bed, views, location and unique layout was perfect.  The swimming pool was in front of the rice fields and everynight we watched the fireflies in the rice fields.  The free shuttle into town (they will actually drop you off wherever you want, as long as it is in town) was easy to use. The morning breakfast which was included was so yummy, creative and I loved how flexible they were with the hours. You can take breakfast anytime from 7am till later in the afternoon!  Plus they offer afternoon tea and cakes wherever you want.. by the pool, in your room or at the restaurant.  Every detail was not overlooked.. the little flowers in the room, the public restroom, welcome drink, cold towels upon arrival.  Nothing was overlooked.  I can't wait to come back... LOVED This place.
title: OMG don't stay anywhere else!

text:
The hotel is mainly for couples but I stayed here with my sister for my 30th birthday and am so glad we chose here. All staff were so friendly and made sure our stay was special. They were so welcoming and helpful. 
The room was spacious and kept clean. We also had an amazing view of the rice fields and luckily the villa we stayed in (villa 4)is in the perfect position to watch the sunrise from the balcony. 
Breakfast was always cooked to perfection and presented beautifully. We had a floating breakfast one morning which was a lovely experience. Breakfast options change everyday so you never get bored. We also took advantage of the free photo shoot which I would definitely recommend. The photographer was amazing, I was so happy with the pictures. 
The hotel itself is located close to the center of Ubud, only about a 10/15 minute drive and conveniently there is a free shuttle bus to take you. I think there are set times it leaves but the staff seemed happy to take us as and when needed. 

I would definitely consider staying at Adiwana Bee House again, (I didn't want to leave!) I can not recommend it enough.
title: The most beautiful and unique place I have stayed

text:
Adiwana Bee House is a warm and beautiful hotel in the midst of rice fields, and feels very new as it was only built about a year ago. Upon stepping into the property from the busy street, you feel relaxed and at peace. We liked that it was a bit removed from the busy city centre (only a 20 min taxi ride away). The rooms feature wood-panelled walls and have a unique and cottage-like feel. The pool has a gorgeous view overlooking the rice terraces.

Staff are wonderful and friendly, and provide you with as many glass water bottles as you like. They refilled my reusable water bottle on request too. On Christmas, they even surprised us with milk and cookies! They were also very helpful arranging shuttles for us into town- and they have a free shuttle a few times a day.

We would definitely recommend staying here!
title: Unique and incredible stay amidst rice fields

text:
We stayed at Adiwana Bee House in December for almost a week as a couple. We had a great experience and definitely recommend the hotel if you’re considering it.

Service: In terms of service, Ana and the team are super friendly and very accommodating. It was a refreshing experience to see the hotel staff care so much about making our stay great. 

Rooms & Amenities: The rooms themselves were very clean and fairly spacious. The concept of staying in a “bee house” was fun. There are two pools spanning the length of the hotel with a majestic view of the rice fields. Very peaceful. The rice fields themselves are spectacular to look at. There is also a nice restaurant onsite overlooking the rice fields, although usually we were out exploring so didn’t have a chance to eat at the restaurant - only some drinks. We had breakfast included which was very comprehensive, lots of options, and definitely filled us up every day. 

Location: The hotel is located fairly close to the centre of Ubud. We chose to walk (about 45 minutes) on some days, even though Adiwana offers a very convenient shuttle service and pickup at multiple times throughout the day. The shuttle made it very convenient on days where we didn’t walk. It is located at the end of a very small road, but none of our drivers had any issues finding it.

Overall would definitely recommend and I will consider it again as an option for our stay.
title: Very enjoyable stay

text:
I have travelled around the world, both as a backpacker and a luxury traveller and have never come across customer service so amazingly attentive as the staff at The Bee House led by the supervisor Bagas, who I would 100% hire for any company I would run the in the future. On our first couple of days we had a few communication mix ups (drove us to the wrong dance, motorcycle rental meetup and pricing for something). We raised these to Bagas and he went ABOVE and BEYOND to rectify the situation, explained that they are still new and that the appreciate the feedback as these things help them get better. The next day we had Angga drive us to the Kecak dance, provided a great background on the dance, walked us to the ticket person, walked us inside to make sure we got front row seats and then picked us up after the dance. Amazing customer service. 

Food: Best on our trip, hands down. Every meal was outstanding both in taste and presentation. Lots of healthy, vegetarian and gluten free options if you need. They were  very flexible in optins due to my girlfriend's allergies. Make sure to have the floating breakfast, very cool experience. My girlfriend setup the romantic dinner and flower bath one night and althought expensive, it was honestly the most stunning romantic dinner I've ever seen (including those in the Caribbean and  Hawaii) The sheer amount of flowers was overwhelming.

Location: You are a 5-10 min motorcycle drive in either direction to the heart of Ubud but in a very quiet spot surrounded by rice fields. I rented a motorbike through them and it was 85K IDR. You are a 20 min drive to the Teggalong Rice Terraces and Water Temple. The drive to the airport will usually take 1.5 - 2.5 hours depending on traffic. Thank you to Komang for our seamless pickup and drop off as well as the brilliant conversation about Bali.

Rooms: Beautiful pool outside, overlooking the rice terraces, most comfortable beds and pillows we had in Indonesia. Beautifully appointed rooms.

Overall we loved our time here and would definitely come back if we stayed in Ubud in the future. Thank you to Bagas and his team for amazing customer service and very memorable stay. Terima Kasih 🙏
title: Best Customer Service in the World

text:
I would give 6 stars if I could!! I really wouldn't know where to start with this place. I could not fault them. The rooms and views are even more incredible in real life! Made out of all bamboo, you feel like you really are staying in the jungle. The first you notice when you stay here is the staff, they are the happiest most lovely helpful people I have ever met. From the waiters to reception. 
The food is hand downs the best I had in Bali and we travelled around. (make sure you try to the Nasi Goreng!!) The free breakfast is UNREAL, so much choice, western and Indonesian, it changes everyday and everything is served with so much attention to detail! The Dragonfruit smoothie bowl is to die for! Plus - a basket of warm Fresh bread and fresh fruit is served with whatever you order.
The maids go to the most effort I have ever seen (and I travel alot!) Laying out slippers and robes at the side of the bed, they even lined up our shoes which were all over the place. 
The best part about Adiwana, is the location, it is so close to everything, but is down a country road so you really feel perfectly isolated and relaxed. The pool is great with loungers and random placed beanbags! Its ideal.
I was worried about bugs and we don't have them in the UK and there are a small gaps in the bamboo houses, there was not one bug or bite over a week! We just sprayed some jungle formula spray on before bed (and we had not nets!) :)
I really could not fault this place. Tropical, unique and like no other! 
I have been around the world in 5* and this is the best place I have stayed for beauty and service
title: Beautiful, perfect, faultless place to stay.

Where do I start on this amazing place. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, we felt as though we were part of the bee-house family. Every single staff member so very helpful. The villa was amazing, the comfiest bed and pillows I had found in my trip around Bali. Spacious rooms, well decorated, great accessories, brilliant shower and bathroom. The best looking place I had stayed in Bali. The view from the villa out over the lagoon type pool looking over the rice paddies was amazing to look at during sunrise in the morning. Everything so clean and tidy. The restaurant delivered on both breakfast and lunch/dinner. A daily changing menu meant that the options were never limited. Food always tasted so fresh and definitely hats of to the chef for the amazing flavours. 
Now I want to talk about the staff, Adi the manager, an absolute pleasure to meet and very helpful in any situation. Bagas the waiter, such a nice guy, felt at ease speaking to him and nothing was ever too much to ask. And finally Angga, an absolute credit to Adiwana Bee House, from the moment I stepped foot in the resort to the moment I left, every detail of my stay was taken care of by him from trips out to learning about local culture to looking for the best food places. He was an outstanding asset to the business, he needed to do no more. I will be staying in touch with Angga and hopefully I will see him and you all again I’m the future. text:
Group of 5 stopped for dinner, they were doing 50% off all food and drink as they had just opened August 1st. It was sensational!

I had the Babi guling steamed buns for start, which were a great ratio of bun to meat and tasted delicious. Then I had the barramundi which came which some vegetables and was perfectly cooked. Finished with the apple pie and ice cream. I also had the negroni, Nusa pimms and a red wine, which were all lovely. The setting is gorgoeous, get here before sunset to appreciate the view.

We ate a variety of the menu and everyone was really impressed, probably our favourite meal of the trip. Very quiet, no traffic and the staff were professional and friendly.

Only criticism came from our vegetarian friend who also couldn't eat nuts, her choices were very limited for dinner.

Would highly recommend the Bee Cafe to anyone looking for an amazing dining experience in a tranquil location. We stayed for 4 hours, we didn't want to leave!
title: Restaurant was incredible

text:
Мы отмечали годовщину свадьбы и номер люкс был идеален для этого. Балкон с видом, вся спальня в экостиле (деревянная даже мойка). Высокие полукруглые потолки создают эффект уюта. Огромные окна, красивая драпировка, элегантная мебель. Супер кровать, подушки и одеяло... Телевизор большой, но нам был не нужен.
На первом этаже в стиле отполированного бетона ванная комната. Очень просторно. Удивила мойка в виде тазика - креативно. Сама ванная огромная, удобная. Обязательно стоит принять.
Халаты в стиле кимоно из тонкой ткани. И это прекрасно, так как в жаркие дни это лучший вариант после ванной.
Нас приняли празднично. Поздравили с годовщиной. Порадовала ванная, наполненная лепестками роз с красным сердцем. На кровати полотенца в виде лебедей также создавали романтику, украшенные лепестками и словами поздравления.
Отдельная благодарность за подачу блюд. Всё красиво оформлено на плетенных подносах и деревянных дощечках. Вкусности к послеобеденному чаю великолепны. Завтрак полноценный, есть, что выбрать, большие порции.
Персонал улыбается, внимателен, очень старается.
Почему-то сразу не было в номере халатов и тапок, хотя были заявлены. После просьбы принесли.
Хотелось бы, чтобы полотенца для бассейна также сразу лежали в номере (например, на первом этаже люкса) либо были в доступе возле бассейна. Приходится просить, а это не очень удобно.
И обязательно обратите внимание на приветственный напиток. Это полезно для здоровья и можно потом заказать в больших бутылках. 
Я рада, что мы смогли узнать для себя это место.
title: Супер для годовщины свадьбы))

text:
Wir haben uns im Dezember 2019 dazu entschieden, das Adiwana Bee House zu besuchen. Normalerweise übernachten wir bei unseren Aufenthalten in Ubud im Adiwana Jembawan und waren sehr auf dieses kleine Hotel gespannt. 

Das Bee House wurde vor wenigen Monaten eröffnet und ist entsprechend im guten Zustand. Wir übernachteten in der Pool Villa, die sich direkt neben dem Bee Cafe befindet. Natürlich hat dieser Standort seine Nachteile, da wir beispielweise die Musik und lautere Gespräche – ob wir wollten oder nicht – gut verfolgen konnten. Der Pool war nicht sehr ansprechend, da einige Baumängel vorzufinden waren. Durch eine fehlerhafte und mangelhafte Farbauswahl sah der Pool aus, als hätte seit Jahren keine Wartung stattgefunden. Wir wurden auf Nachfrage was mit dem Pool passiert ist aufgeklärt, dass der Pool durch eine ungünstige Farbauswahl so aussieht. Eine Behebung des Zustands ist jedoch schwierig, da der Pool für einige Tage nicht verwendbar ist. Auch bei der Villa sind einige Mängel vorzufinden, was jedoch keine große Auswirkung auf den Wohlfühlfaktor hat. Sollten wir nochmal im Bee House übernachten, würden wir auf jeden Fall die andere Pool Villa bzw. eine „normale“ Villa buchen.

Das anliegende Bee Cafe (wir haben dazu eine separate Bewertung geschrieben: https://www.tripadvisor.de/ShowUserReviews-g3932211-d17753683-r736506003-Bee_Cafe_Ubud-Peliatan_Ubud_Gianyar_Regency_Bali.html) ist eine sehr gute Möglichkeit für Frühstück, Mittag- und Abendessen. Speziell Okta ist hier hervorzuheben!

Die Mitarbeiter (vielen Dank an Angga für die zahlreichen Informationen und Hinweise) sind sehr nett und bemühen sich jeden Wunsch zu erfüllen! Ob das Bee House in Zukunft erfolgreich sein wird, hängt aus unserer Sicht stark vom Management ab. Die verantwortlichen Personen müssen dringend damit beginnen, eine bessere Kundenorientierung zu etablieren. In unserem Fall sollten wir für eine kostenpflichtigen Yoga-Class im Adiwana Jembawan auch für den Transport dahin bezahlen. Erst nach einer schriftlichen Beschwerde, wieso für ein kostenpflichtiges Angebot der gleichen Hotelkette innerhalb von Ubud auch noch Transportkosten entstehen, wurde diese Festlegung revidiert. Hoffentlich wird das Adiwana Management die Vorteile einer Hotelkette innerhalb einer Stadt zukünftig besser ausnutzen und den Gästen entsprechende Vorteile bieten. 

Auch wenn sich die Bewertung eher negativ liest, haben wir unseren Aufenthalt genossen. Trotz der ruhigen Lage ist das Zentrum von Ubud nur 15 Minuten zu Fuß erreichbar. Die Anlage ist insgesamt sehr schön und ist von der Form außergewöhnlich. Die Sauberkeit und der Zimmerservice ist sehr gut.
title: Außergewöhnliches Hotel der Adiwana Kette

text:
Séjour de 4 nuits dans cette endroit génialissime. Le chemin pour arriver ici est à se dire que l'on c'est trompé, que l'on c'est perdu. Mais dès que vous franchissez l'entrée, un spectacle magique opère de suite. La vue pour commencer au milieu des rizières et en fond des cocotiers qui garnissent l'horizon...superbe !!!
L’accueil est très bien et tout le personnel se révélera très gentil et surtout attentionné.
Le jardin magnifiquement aménagé et très bien entretenu.
La piscine si belle et si agréable dominant les rizières avec possibilité de prendre son petit à l’intérieur sur des plateaux flottants.
Et puis les chambres: Tout y est beau, fonctionnel, dans un style magnifique.
On se sent tellement bien dans ce lieu qu'il en est difficile d'en repartir.
Il faut juste préciser que les rizières, selon l'époque peuvent être à nue, et ne correspondent pas à l'attente des photos arborant un vert unique. Mais c'est normal.
Autre précision, malgré les rizières, aucun moustique ne viendra gâcher cette sérénité que cet endroit nous offre.
Ce lieu est unique, un véritable coup de cœur !!
title: Un vrai coup de cœur

text:
Das Haus war ein Traum! Ein offener Wohnraum mit toller Badewanne im Erdgeschoss, im 1. Stock ein wunderschönes Schlafzimmer mit extra gelegener Dusche und WC, und der große Balkon mit traumhaften Ausblick auf die Reisfelder und den Palmen war das i-Tüpfelchen :)
Auch der Pool hat uns sofort begeistert, obwohl es ein großer Gemeinschafts-Pool ist hat durch den schlängelnden Verlauf und die Größe jeder seinen „eigenen“ Bereich, inclusive eigener Liegen, welche durch Sträuchern schön versteckt sind. Das Resort liegt etwas abgelegen der busy City, und genau das macht es so schön, dennoch kann man zu Fuß in 10 Gehminuten einen Supermarkt und anderes erreichen. Man kann sich aber auch jeder Zeit über die Rezeption einen Fahrer organisieren.
Die Mitarbeiter des „Hotels“ müssen bei dieser Bewertung speziell gelobt werden, sofort hat man sich wie zu Hause gefühlt, Die Rezeption ist sehr zuvorkommend, die Servicekräfte des Restaurants und der Küche wahnsinnig  lieb und hilfsbereit, jeder Wunsch wird von den Lippen abgelesen.
Pasek und Okta waren für uns nicht nur super Servicekräfte, die ihren Job brilliant machen, sie sind für uns auch Freunde geworden. Aber auch der Rest der Crew (wir wissen leider nicht mehr alle Namen) waren einfach nur spitze! Das Essen hervorragend, frisch und gesund! 
Wir hatten Frühstück inclusive, man hat jedoch zusätzlich nachmittags inclusive einen Tee mit kleinen Snack auf das Zimmer erhalten. 
Wir würden das Hotel bei unserer nächsten Bali Reise auf jeden Fall wieder buchen!
Vielen Dank für die tollen Aufenthalt!
title: Absolute Empfehlung

text:
4 nuits merveilleuses dans ce petit havre de paix niché au creux des rizières. La ruche avec piscine privée était juste somptueuse. L’hotel est impeccable du soir au matin, rien à redire. Le personnel est aux petits soins, toujours prêt à rendre service. La piscine principale de l’hotel est magnifique et le restaurant est très bon. Nous avons meme eu le droit à une petite attention particulière pour notre voyage de noces: un joli et très bon gateau au chocolat 🙂
L’hotel est à environ 4kms du centre d’ubud, prévoyer environ 1h/1h30 pour le faire à pieds sinon partez sur les « taxis » locaux (appelés « local transport »). L’hotel propose des navettes gratuites vers le centre d’ubud et vers l’hotel plusieurs fois par jours. Cela est pratique mais en dehors de ces horaires les prix proposés par l’hotel sont très élevés. Privilégiez la negocation avec les « taxis » locaux.
Si nous devions chercher un bémol, nous dirions peut etre qu’il est dommage que la ruche avec piscine privée (la plus cher de l’hotel) soit située à coté du restaurant et de la reception qui occasionnent quelques nuisances sonores, mais c’est vraiment pour chercher la petite bête car cela ne nous a pas pour autant dérangés. Nous conseillons les yeux fermés. Merci encore à toute l’équipe.
title: Petit havre de paix

text:
Im Adiwana Bee House bleibt wirklich kein Wunsch offen. Angefangen von der überwältigenden Aussicht auf die Reisfelder und den Dschungel, bishin zum unglaublich freundlichen und hilfsbereiten Personal. 
Wir hatten die Poolhouse-Villa und es war genauso wie auf den Bildern im Internet dargestellt - wenn nicht schöner. Wir hatten eine unvergessliche Woche und würde immer wieder kommen. Das reichhaltige Frühstück und köstliche Essen kann man sowohl in die Häuser serviert bekommen, als auch im Bee-Café genießen. Die Aussieht vom Café aus ist unbeschreiblich und das Personal sehr zuvorkommend. 
Insgesamt haben alle Mitarbeiten dazu beigetragen, dass wir eine unvergessliche Zeit verbringen durften. Ganz besonders an dieser Stelle ein großes Lob an Okta - mit ihrer charmanten Art hat sie uns immer ein Lächeln ins Gesicht gezaubert und ein Platz in unserem Herzen gewonnen. Für jeden, der ein ganz besonderes Foto möchte empfehlen wir das Blumenbad. Damit haben wir unglaublich ausgefallene Bilder gemacht, da sie ein wunderschönes Muster dekoriert haben. 
Danke an das Adiwana Bee House und an alle Mitarbeiten für die wunderschöne Zeit! Wir werden uns Wiedersehen! Christian und Elena 

 
In the Adiwana Bee House there is really no wish left unfulfilled. From the overwhelming view of the rice fields and the jungle to the incredibly friendly and helpful staff. 
We had the Poolhouse villa and it was just like the pictures on the internet - if not more beautiful. We had an unforgettable week and would come back again and again. The breakfast (and the food) can be served in the villa as well as in the Bee-Café. The look from the café is indescribable and the staff very courteous. 
All in all, all the employees contributed to the fact that we were able to spend an unforgettable time. Especially at this point a big praise to Okta - with her charming way she always put a smile on our faces and won a place in our hearts. For everyone who wants a very special photo, we recommend the Flower Bath. With this we have made unbelievably unusual pictures, because they have decorated a beautiful pattern. 
Thanks to the Adiwana Bee House and to all the staff for the wonderful time! We will meet again! Christian and Elena
